content: THE HAGUE, May 4 (Reuters) - Belgium is preparing a new package of military aid for Ukraine, Belgian Prime Minister Alexander De Croo said on Thursday during a visit by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to The Hague.

Speaking to journalists alongside Zelenskiy and Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte, De Croo also said his government was examining how frozen Russian assets could be used to help Ukraine's war effort. (Reporting by Benoit Van Overstraeten and Bart Meijer; Editing by Charlotte Van Campenhout)
